Name: ConditionHdrVS
Title: Condition Value Set
Descriptino: Hospital Discharge Report Condition value set includes selected codes from recommended EU code systems for health conditions (WHO-ICD-10, SNOMED CT and Orphacodes).

Name: AdministrativeGender
Title: AdministrativeGender
Descriptino: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes.

Name: SNOMEDCTBodyStructures
Title: SNOMED CT Body Structures
Descriptino: This value set includes all codes from [SNOMED CT](http://snomed.info/sct) where concept is-a 442083009 (Anatomical or acquired body site (body structure)).

Name: BundleType
Title: BundleType
Descriptino: Indicates the purpose of a bundle - how it is intended to be used.

Name: SNOMEDCTClinicalFindings
Title: SNOMED CT Clinical Findings
Descriptino: This value set includes all the "Clinical finding" [SNOMED CT](http://snomed.info/sct) codes - concepts where concept is-a 404684003 (Clinical finding (finding)).

Name: CompositionAttestationMode
Title: CompositionAttestationMode
Descriptino: The way in which a person authenticated a composition.

Name: CompositionStatus
Title: CompositionStatus
Descriptino: The workflow/clinical status of the composition.

Name: ConditionCategoryCodes
Title: Condition Category Codes
Descriptino: Preferred value set for Condition Categories.

Name: ConditionClinicalStatusCodes
Title: Condition Clinical Status Codes
Descriptino: Preferred value set for Condition Clinical Status.

Name: Condition/Problem/DiagnosisCodes
Title: Condition/Problem/Diagnosis Codes
Descriptino: Example value set for Condition/Problem/Diagnosis codes.

Name: Condition/DiagnosisSeverity
Title: Condition/Diagnosis Severity
Descriptino: Preferred value set for Condition/Diagnosis severity grading.

Name: ConditionStage
Title: Condition Stage
Descriptino: Example value set for stages of cancer and other conditions.

Name: ConditionStageType
Title: Condition Stage Type
Descriptino: Example value set for the type of stages of cancer and other conditions

Name: ConditionVerificationStatus
Title: ConditionVerificationStatus
Descriptino: The verification status to support or decline the clinical status of the condition or diagnosis.

Name: ContactPointSystem
Title: ContactPointSystem
Descriptino: Telecommunications form for contact point.

Name: ContactPointUse
Title: ContactPointUse
Descriptino: Use of contact point.

Name: DataAbsentReason
Title: DataAbsentReason
Descriptino: Used to specify why the normally expected content of the data element is missing.

Name: ProcedureDeviceActionCodes
Title: Procedure Device Action Codes
Descriptino: Example codes indicating the change that happened to the device during the procedure.  Note that these are in no way complete and might not even be appropriate for some uses.

Name: FHIRDeviceTypes
Title: FHIR Device Types
Descriptino: Codes used to identify medical devices. Includes concepts from SNOMED CT (http://www.snomed.org/) where concept is-a 49062001 (Device)  and is provided as a suggestive example.

Name: DiagnosticReportStatus
Title: DiagnosticReportStatus
Descriptino: The status of the diagnostic report.

Name: DiagnosticServiceSectionCodes
Title: Diagnostic Service Section Codes
Descriptino: This value set includes all the codes in HL7 V2 table 0074.

Name: DocumentSectionCodes
Title: Document Section Codes
Descriptino: Document section codes (LOINC codes used in CCDA sections).

Name: FHIRDocumentTypeCodes
Title: FHIR Document Type Codes
Descriptino: FHIR Document Codes - all LOINC codes where scale type = 'DOC'.

Name: DocumentClassValueSet
Title: Document Class Value Set
Descriptino: This is the code specifying the high-level kind of document (e.g. Prescription, Discharge Summary, Report, etc.). Note: Class code for documents comes from LOINC, and is based upon one of the following:The type of service described by the document. It is described at a very high level in Section 7.3 of the LOINC Manual. The type study performed. It was determined by identifying modalities for study reports. The section of the chart where the document is placed. It was determined from the SETs created for Claims Attachment requests.

Name: DocumentRelationshipType
Title: DocumentRelationshipType
Descriptino: The type of relationship between documents.

Name: EventStatus
Title: EventStatus
Descriptino: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of an event.

Name: HTTPVerb
Title: HTTPVerb
Descriptino: HTTP verbs (in the HTTP command line). See [HTTP rfc](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231) for details.

Name: Identifier Type Codes
Title: IdentifierType
Descriptino: A coded type for an identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.

Name: IdentifierUse
Title: IdentifierUse
Descriptino: Identifies the purpose for this identifier, if known .

Name: CommonLanguages
Title: Common Languages
Descriptino: This value set includes common codes from BCP-47 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47)

Name: LinkType
Title: LinkType
Descriptino: The type of link between this patient resource and another patient resource.

Name: ListEmptyReasons
Title: List Empty Reasons
Descriptino: General reasons for a list to be empty. Reasons are either related to a summary list (i.e. problem or medication list) or to a workflow related list (i.e. consultation list).

Name: ListMode
Title: ListMode
Descriptino: The processing mode that applies to this list.

Name: ListOrderCodes
Title: List Order Codes
Descriptino: Base values for the order of the items in a list resource.

Name: ManifestationAndSymptomCodes
Title: Manifestation and Symptom Codes
Descriptino: Example value set for Manifestation and Symptom codes.

Name: Marital Status Codes
Title: MaritalStatus
Descriptino: This value set defines the set of codes that can be used to indicate the marital status of a person.

Name: Mime Types
Title: MimeType
Descriptino: This value set includes all possible codes from BCP-13 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp13)

Name: NameUse
Title: NameUse
Descriptino: The use of a human name.

Name: ObservationCategoryCodes
Title: Observation Category Codes
Descriptino: Observation Category codes.

Name: LOINCCodes
Title: LOINC Codes
Descriptino: This value set includes all LOINC codes

Name: ObservationInterpretationCodes
Title: Observation Interpretation Codes
Descriptino: A categorical assessment, providing a rough qualitative interpretation of the observation value,    such as “normal”/ “abnormal”,”low” / “high”, “better” / “worse”, “susceptible” / “resistant”, “expected”/ “not expected”.    The value set is intended to be for ANY use where coded representation of an interpretation is needed.             Notes:          This is being communicated in v2.x in OBX-8 (Observation Interpretation), in v3 in ObservationInterpretation (CWE) in R1 (Representative Realm) and in FHIR in    Observation.interpretation. Historically these values come from the laboratory domain, and these codes are extensively    used. The value set binding is extensible, so codes outside the value set that are needed for interpretation concepts    (i.e. particular meanings) that are not included in the value set can be used, and these new codes may also be added to    the value set and published in a future version.

Name: ObservationMethods
Title: Observation Methods
Descriptino: Observation Method codes from [SNOMED CT](http://snomed.info/sct) where concept is-a 272394005 (Technique (qualifier value)) or is-a 129264002 (Action (qualifier value)) or is-a 386053000 (Evaluation procedure(procedure))

Name: ObservationStatus
Title: ObservationStatus
Descriptino: Codes providing the status of an observation.

Name: PatientContactRelationship
Title: Patient Contact Relationship
Descriptino: The nature of the relationship between the patient and the contact person.

Name: ProcedurePerformerRoleCodes
Title: Procedure Performer Role Codes
Descriptino: This example value set defines the set of codes that can be used to indicate a role of a procedure performer.

Name: ProcedureCategoryCodes(SNOMEDCT)
Title: Procedure Category Codes (SNOMED CT)
Descriptino: Procedure Category code: A selection of relevant SNOMED CT codes.

Name: ProcedureFollowUpCodes(SNOMEDCT)
Title: Procedure Follow up Codes (SNOMED CT)
Descriptino: Procedure follow up codes: A selection of SNOMED CT codes relevant to procedure follow up.

Name: ProcedureNotPerformedReason(SNOMED-CT)
Title: Procedure Not Performed Reason (SNOMED-CT)
Descriptino: Situation codes describing the reason that a procedure, which might otherwise be expected, was not performed, or a procedure that was started and was not completed. Consists of SNOMED CT codes, children of procedure contraindicated (183932001), procedure discontinued (416406003), procedure not done (416237000), procedure not indicated (428119001), procedure not offered (416064006), procedure not wanted (416432009), procedure refused (183944003), and procedure stopped (394908001).

Name: ProcedureOutcomeCodes(SNOMEDCT)
Title: Procedure Outcome Codes (SNOMED CT)
Descriptino: Procedure Outcome code: A selection of relevant SNOMED CT codes.

Name: ProcedureReasonCodes
Title: Procedure Reason Codes
Descriptino: This example value set defines the set of codes that can be used to indicate a reason for a procedure.

Name: ObservationReferenceRangeAppliesToCodes
Title: Observation Reference Range Applies To Codes
Descriptino: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the particular target population the reference range applies to.

Name: ObservationReferenceRangeMeaningCodes
Title: Observation Reference Range Meaning Codes
Descriptino: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the meaning/use of a reference range for a particular target population.

Name: LOINCDiagnosticReportCodes
Title: LOINC Diagnostic Report Codes
Descriptino: This value set includes LOINC codes that relate to Diagnostic Observations.

Name: ResourceType
Title: ResourceType
Descriptino: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

Name: SearchEntryMode
Title: SearchEntryMode
Descriptino: Why an entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement, or to convey information or warning information about the search process.

Name: SignatureTypeCodes
Title: Signature Type Codes
Descriptino: The Digital Signature Purposes, an indication of the reason an entity signs a document. This is included in the signed information and can be used when determining accountability for various actions concerning the document. Examples include: author, transcriptionist/recorder, and witness.

Name: ProceduresSnomedCtUvIps
Title: Procedures (SNOMED CT) - IPS
Descriptino: This value set includes codes from SNOMED Clinical Terms®: descendants of 71388002 \|Procedure (procedure)\|, excluding [all subtypes of 14734007 \|Administrative procedure (procedure)\|, all subtypes of 59524001 \|Blood bank procedure (procedure)\|, all subtypes of 389067005 \|Community health procedure (procedure)\|, all subtypes of 442006003 \|Determination of information related to transfusion (procedure)\|, all subtypes of 225288009 \|Environmental care procedure (procedure)\|, all subtypes of 308335008 \|Patient encounter procedure (procedure)\|, all subtypes of 710135002 \|Promotion (procedure)\|, all subtypes of 389084004 \|Staff related procedure (procedure)\|].

Name: EHDSIConditionPOA
Title: eHDSI Condition Present On Admission
Descriptino: The Value Set is used to assert if a condition is Present on Admission

Name: EHDSITreatmentClass
Title: eHDSI Treatment Class
Descriptino: The Value set is used to encode category of treatment of the condition during encounter

Name: ActCode
Title: v3 Code System ActCode
Descriptino: A code specifying the particular kind of Act that the Act-instance represents within its class.  Constraints:  The kind of Act (e.g. physical examination, serum potassium, inpatient encounter, charge financial transaction, etc.) is specified with a code from one of several, typically external, coding systems.  The coding system will depend on the class of Act, such as LOINC for observations, etc. Conceptually, the Act.code must be a specialization of the Act.classCode. This is why the structure of ActClass domain should be reflected in the superstructure of the ActCode domain and then individual codes or externally referenced vocabularies subordinated under these domains that reflect the ActClass structure. Act.classCode and Act.code are not modifiers of each other but the Act.code concept should really imply the Act.classCode concept. For a negative example, it is not appropriate to use an Act.code "potassium" together with and Act.classCode for "laboratory observation" to somehow mean "potassium laboratory observation" and then use the same Act.code for "potassium" together with Act.classCode for "medication" to mean "substitution of potassium". This mutually modifying use of Act.code and Act.classCode is not permitted.

Name: v3.ConfidentialityClassification
Title: V3 Value SetConfidentialityClassification
Descriptino: Set of codes used to value Act.Confidentiality and Role.Confidentiality attribute in accordance with the definition for concept domain "Confidentiality".
